review:
Absolutely wonderful experience under Dr. Shefali Tyagi and her team.

I continued my entire pregnancy journey under a different doctor as it was closer to my home, despite having no comfort with the doctor. I assumed that the doctor being knowledgeable was sufficient and that patients can’t expect to be treated with respect or empathy. I had friends who had delivered under her care but since Sarjapur is far from my location, I didn’t want to travel in such horrible roads, without knowing if the experience would be worth it.

Somehow, out of anxiety regarding an uncomfortable birth experience, at 37th week, I decided to give Dr. Shefali Tyagi a try. It was an instant click. Her proficiency, knowledge and empathy was unparalleled. The fact that I thought doctors will always be unempathetic and irritated if they are busy, was thrown out of the window instantly. She was respectful of the birth plan I wished for. She explained me the pros and cons of my choice and what other alternative I had, which she could help me with. But once I made up my mind, she helped me in each step through it.

I delivered under her on February first week and my baby is one week old now. My delivery experience and subsequent visits to her have been wonderful. Within a week, I feel almost fine. The doctor I had been in touch with for 9 months never gave me an email id to contact during emergencies. Even during visits, anything we asked was met with irritated replies. She suggested going to the hospital emergency for any doubt and that’s what we did every time, for 9 months.

With Dr. Shefali Tyagi, from day 1 she had shared her email ID and has always responded to emergency/nonemergency doubt within less than an hour, even though I had just started to visit her. I wish I had this kind of support throughout my pregnancy.

During the time I was at the hospital, she even treated my mother for a long-standing issue and my mother was happy with the experience too. Since I had willingly opted for a C-section, she also removed an ovarian cyst for me, which had been there for 15 years almost. 

Would absolutely recommend the doctor. Finally, I had an amazing birth experience, which I had absolutely lost hope for. I don’t have a single thing to complain about.

I visited Dr. Shefali Tyagi for consultation for my wife who is in her second trimester. Usually people gets opinion/feedabck after meeting the doctor in person but my case is entirely different. Before I visited doctor (for the first time), I mentioned little history of my wife's health condition. I was very much surprised with her call and asking about my wife's current health conditions. 

My wife was suffering with very high fever and full body ache and I could not get appointment earlier than monday evening. She checked this helath history and on friday itself she called me. I literally salute her for the professionalism and concern/care towards her patients. From friday to monday, she constantly checked all my emails, guided for what all tests needs to be done, checked all reports before I could meet and provided medication need to be started asap.

This gives me and my wife immense mental support and we didnt feel any more worries. The professional gesture of her doesn't ends here. She further informed me that I can visit on Monday morning itself since it would have been already four and half days by then. When we reached to Cloudnine Bellandur, we were schedule very next after the current patient she was consulting. Finally we met her, explained complete medical history, showed all test reports and she ensures that we feel staisfied by giving ample time for consultation.

I was in favor of getting my wife admitted since "Viral Fever" was a scary thing in Pregnancy but she denied for same as it was not required and rest can be taken at home as well. Its very tough in this era to find medical professional who doesnt run behind money and rather entirely focus on well being and earliest recovery of patients helath.

After acknowledging all these, I am still feeling short of words to express my respect towards her. 

Again Thank You so very much Doctor for all your guidance, concern and care towards my wife's health.

review:
I had been consulting Dr Shefali Tyagi at Motherhood and want to share my experience. She is one of the Esteem doctors maybe in entire Medical Fraternity that forgot to do most basic test done during Pregnancy -  Urine test . In my first 20 weeks, she did not recommend Urine test even once.   When we went and asked her about it , she casually said that Urine test is not mandatory and she recommends only if required . I was later detected with a UTI infection ...had she recommended Urine test at each visit like all doctors in the world do , maybe there was a chance that UTI could have been detected earlier,

She might have done 100 successful deliveries , but if a doctor fails to  follow basis procedure , rule of thumb and most important test during Pregnancy, then i don't call it a mistake ....I call it 'NOT FIT FOR PRACTICE' .  Without Urine test, there is no way to get early indication of UTI infection, sugar or Protein .

In this case, it has been a case of Negligence - breach of a legal duty to take care.  A doctor vows certain duties to the patient who consults him for his illness.  A deficiency in his service results in negligence, which is termed as medical negligence.

I suggest all to be mothers  consulting her to be careful and do your basic study and be cognizant of all test reqd at each month .
We go to doctors by confiding in them,  assuming that they will help us bring our bundle of joy into this world and this happens , it shakes your entire belief on such doctors.

It maybe 1 in 1000 mistake by Dr Shefali , but in no way can someone believe that a Gyno doctor can forget Urine test . I checked this with my known doctors across the world and  everyone had one word for it - BLUNDER.

We also requested the Dr and Motherhood to atleast render an apology but that also was too much to ask for  - In today's world , this is a big business and everyone talks about bottom line margins and profit.

As long as more and more women will keep on consulting her, Motherhood will keep her on board.

I will also pursue the case Legally with her .
